body: Please, show your `getCounty` method in `Regions` model
It may better come from the method `getRegions` in `User` model as suggested by region.userid. May we have a look?

> WHERE "region".UserID=8

From where does this condition come?
Could you create a failing test, please?
Could you please elaborate on what I need to do?
I'm asking you to create a test case that shows wrong quoting

Well, I am not good at test cases, but scenario I have mentioned already as above. Confusing part is while using `with` it works but not while using `joinWith`, which says relation setup is correct is code.
Hard to tell, maybe in the primarykey() method. Can you post the models and methods involved and also the controller part to see how is assigned the userid?
Sure I will post details soon. fyi, I have not modified `primarykey()` method.

Here goes the details:

My Table Schema:

```
CREATE TABLE `order` (
  `orderid` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
  `amount` varchar(45) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`orderid`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=6 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;

CREATE TABLE `order_item` (
  `order_item_id` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
  `orderid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `itemid` int(11) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`order_item_id`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=11 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;

CREATE TABLE `item` (
  `itemid` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
  `itemname` varchar(45) NOT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`itemid`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB AUTO_INCREMENT=6 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;

```

## Controller Code:

```
$order = \app\models\Order::findOne(1);
$items = $order->getOrderitems()->joinWith('item')->all();
```

## Query Generated:

```
SELECT `order_item`.* FROM `order_item` LEFT JOIN `item` ON `order_item`.`itemid` = `item`.`itemid` WHERE `order_item`.orderid=1
```

### Please note the quotes in `WHERE` condition.

## Model Code:

Attached Model Files in txt format

[Item.txt](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/files/173456/Item.txt)
[Order.txt](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/files/173457/Order.txt)
[OrderItem.txt](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/files/173458/OrderItem.txt)

Let me know if I have missed anything.

All I can say is, when you already have AR object and trying to fetch related data by calling relation method and along with fetching nested data and using `joinWith`, in this case it is skipping the quotes on primary key of your AR Object.

Thank you. Your code sounds ok, it could be a bug.
However I can't reproduce the case (I'm not using mysql though).
Are you sure to use the stable unmodified version of yii2.0.7 (yii/db/ActiveQuery.php, yii/db/QueryBuilder.php, yii/db/Schema.php and yii/db/mysql/Schema.php) ?

Yes I am sure on this part that no core files were modified. I can provide insert statements of my tables. For MySQL it will work because no quotes are mandatory but in case of PostgreSQL, it is required. 

@cebe @samdark @SilverFire  any thoughts here?
